before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ehie","text":"You should have a working installation of the Schrödinger Software suite version 2020-4 or newer on a supported version of a supported Linux distribution. See  Supported Platforms for more information.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":19}],"data":{}},{"key":"3h2u5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bh6c2","text":"Set the environment variable SCHRODINGER to the installation directory of the Schrödinger software. For example, for a bash shell, enter the following:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1900s","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9f83a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"867FCF8E355311EBB3A90A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://www.schrodinger.com/supportedplatforms"}},"1":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"en324","text":"export SCHRODINGER=/path/to/schrodinger2020-4","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4etr","text":"This tutorial partially copies steps from How to Assign CHARMM Parameters to Desmond-generated System with viparr4 but differs in the parametrization steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":42,"length":72}],"data":{}},{"key":"28p1h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkpug","text":"You can use the Schrödinger software suite to prepare systems for molecular dynamics simulations, however, only the OPLS _2005 and OPLS4 force fields can be automatically assigned. This tutorial will show you how to use Desmond with third-party force fields like AMBER, using the Viparr utility from D.E. Shaw Research.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6uhop","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"av7g0","text":"You will prepare a protein-ligand complex, generate custom AMBER parameters for the ligand, and use the Viparr utility to convert the generated AMBER parameters into a viparr-formatted template, that can be used for simulations. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69fhv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ao98","text":"You can find the input files for this tutorial here:   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":53,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fpk55","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"441EA42037E511EC859D7D6E573FF17E","url":"http://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bp53mq8n"}},"1":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"C2F247B037E111EC859D7D6E573FF17E","id":182026,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"amber_to_desmond.tgz","placeholder":"","raw_source":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ft2kbnr87.tgz"}}}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"aag6u","text":"The converter tool described in this document is not supported by either Schrödinger Inc. or D.E. Shaw Research. For help please consult other Desmond users via Google Desmond Group.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":161,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":161,"length":20}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"5D39771F30F111EB952C0A58A9FEAC2A","url":"http://groups.google.com/group/desmond-md-users"}}}}

fork_info.title: How to Assign CHARMM Parameters to Desmond-generated System with viparr4

keywords: ,Molecular Dynamics, MD, Desmond, CHARMM, Amber, Force Field, Simulations
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"57rsb","text":"Schrödinger Software version 2020-4 or newer installed on a supported platform with Linux","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":60,"length":18}],"data":{}},{"key":"dmu3d","text":"Bash shell","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69a32","text":"Optional: git","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"einvh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"13bvm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"FCC40320356711EB82A7550681F0C6F9","url":"https://www.schrodinger.com/supportedplatforms"}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b2b35","text":"In order to run MDs with Desmond, you'll also need a supported Nvidia GPU.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"91apc","text":"Set up a Python Virtual Environment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c3phc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c609u","text":"In order to avoid compatibility issues with the Python modules, and ensure interoperability with Schrödinger's Python modules, use the Schrödinger software to create a new virtual environment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8r29h","text":"Install the Viparr and Msys Utilities","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccubf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bn6tn","text":"Viparr is a utility developed by D.E. Shaw Research to assign force field parameters to systems, which can then be used to perform MD simulations with Desmond. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7frg7","text":"Now that the system is prepared with AMBER parameters, Desmond can minimize, equilibrate, and run an MD simulation of the system. For further information check the Desmond User Manual.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":164,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e9sam","text":"Set up an MD Simulation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hr9a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvf3v","text":"In Maestro, go to Tasks → Desmond → Molecular Dynamics to open the Molecular Dynamics panel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":18,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":26,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":19},{"style":"bold","offset":67,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":91,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19hra","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c57of","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9pfld","text":"In the Model system section, choose Import from a file, and click Browse to locate and load amber-start.cms","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":92,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"h56a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hq80","text":"In the Model system section, select Import from file, browse to the file amber-start.cms, and click Load.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":73,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":100,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kun5","text":"Optional: Adjust simulation parameters, such as simulation time. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a4pjg","text":"Ensure the Relax model system before simulation checkbox is selected.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f74g0","text":"Optional: Enter a job name, click the gear icon to change job settings, or click the ? icon to open the Help for more information.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":85,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2ksp","text":"Click Run to start the MD simulation.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"3C289C90338A11EBAA995B1596B3F3E0","height":316.9999999999999,"id":182133,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5v0pm","text":"Molecular Dynamics Panel","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/76a50887d8f1c2e9301755428990ad81479ee21c25b43215cf524541e0503269/csf3jc.png","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ft5xjc.jpg","type":1,"webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ft5wjc.webp","width":215.51297898640289}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cb7vk","text":"Analyze the Results","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqvev","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vj10","text":"In Maestro, go to Tasks → Desmond → Simulation Interactions Diagram (SID) and 'Load ...' in the .eaf file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":18,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":26,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":32},{"style":"bold","offset":73,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Assigning AMBER Force Fields to the Molecular System
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fva23","text":"Now, we can reassign the AMBER force field to the CMS file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94mu8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lp17","text":"The viparr utility comes with standard sets of protein parameters which we can use for the protein.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqded","text":"For the Ibuprofen ligand, we can use the viparr template in the directory IBP.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7neh","text":"First, we download a structure from the protein data base (PDB) and prepare the protein-ligand complex. This tutorial uses a PDB structure  for the human adipocyte lipid-binding protein FABP4 in complex with (S)-ibuprofen (PDB ID: 3p6h).We build the system with Schrödinger's Maestro and Desmond tools. The default force field used by the Schrödinger software is OPLS_2005 (OPLS3e if you have a license). After building the system for MD simulations, we can reassign the forcefield using Viparr.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":231,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"31c4k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qbgs","text":"To prepare the system for MD, open Maestro and follow these steps:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"76688E90355811EB86A475D90F82FB45","url":"https://www.rcsb.org/structure/3P6H"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4lvpg","text":"Prepare the Protein-Ligand Complex","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64ss9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5kjug","text":"In Maestro, go to Tasks  → Protein Preparation and Refinement  → Protein Preparation Wizard or click Protein Preparation in the toolbar.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":18,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":27,"length":34},{"style":"bold","offset":65,"length":26},{"style":"bold","offset":101,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"esldh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ads70","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dm15b","text":"In the Protein Preparation Wizard, enter ‘3p6h’ in the PDB text box, and click Import to download the structure from the PDB database and import it into Maestro.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":55,"length":3},{"style":"bold","offset":79,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22hii","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96un9","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5mi19","text":"After the PDB has been imported into the 3D workspace, preprocess the protein and the ligand. In the Protein Preparation Wizard, make sure the following options are selected:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btrih","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9sahv","text":"Assign bond orders","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66fc5","text":"Add hydrogens","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ermnu","text":"Create disulfide bonds","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b10pi","text":"Cap termini","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0la7","text":"Fill in missing side chains using Prime (requires a Prime license)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6h79g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8cgh1","text":"Click Preprocess.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2tsad","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jsga","text":"The Protein Preparation Wizard runs structural sanity checks and displays potential issues in a warning. In this tutorial, you can safely ignore these warnings and click OK to close the warning. In real applications, you should pay close attention to these warnings and resolve issues that may lead to problems during the MD simulations. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hdn0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d8e97","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2u3tf","text":"After the Protein Preparation Wizard finishes, a protein-ligand complex is added to Maestro's Workspace where formal charges, protonation states and bond orders are assigned and hydrogen atoms are added to the protein, ligand and crystallographic water molecules.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"52167460319A11EBBE8E2953DBA42A0D","height":107.63999999999996,"id":182135,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/76a50887d8f1c2e9301755428990ad81479ee21c25b43215cf524541e0503269/cr9rjc.png","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ft5zjc.jpg","type":1,"webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ft5yjc.webp","width":325.28571428571416}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"60CD80D0319911EBBE8E2953DBA42A0D","height":266.9999999999999,"id":182137,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cbat3","text":"Protein Preparation Wizard","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/76a50887d8f1c2e9301755428990ad81479ee21c25b43215cf524541e0503269/cr9qjc.png","shadow":true,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ft53jc.jpg","type":1,"webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ft52jc.webp","width":226.2711864406779}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"erich","text":"For the 3p6h structure, the Protein Preparation Wizard shows missing atoms on the terminal residues. Since we cap the terminals, this is not an issue. Further, overlapping atoms and alternative residue positions can be ignored for this tutorial. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c67qa","text":"Solvate and Neutralize the Protein-Ligand Complex","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":49}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5b0v0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"altv5","text":"Now that we have a protein-ligand complex loaded in the Workspace, we can solvate and neutralize the complex to prepare it for MD simulations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"299iq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3emas","text":"In Maestro, go to Tasks → Desmond → System Builder to open the System Builder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":18,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":26,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s4ib","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fe4gt","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6vpc8","text":"Click Run to build the system with the default settings. By default, a water buffer of 10 Å and neutralizing counterions are added to the protein-ligand complex. The System Builder also assigns OPLS_2005 force field parameters (or OPLS3e if you have a license) to the protein-ligand atoms using SPC as the model for water. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eun4s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"785qd","text":"After the System Builder finishes, a solvated system is added to Maestro's Workspace. The solvated system is also saved to a file desmond_setup_1-out.cms.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":130,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19ml6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6atpv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"FF19FD30319A11EBBE8E2953DBA42A0D","height":370.3763636363642,"id":182139,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"logk","text":"System Builder","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/76a50887d8f1c2e9301755428990ad81479ee21c25b43215cf524541e0503269/cr9sjc.png","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ft55jc.jpg","type":1,"webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ft54jc.webp","width":228.1153415453531}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e0oaq","text":"To simulate a molecule that is not covered by the standard AMBER parameter set, you first need to obtain parameter files for that molecule. You can obtain parameters from one of these sources:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"da4ib","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70nt2","text":"Deriving parameters via AmberTools antechamber as shown in these tutorials: AM1-bcc or RESP fitting","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":76,"length":7},{"key":1,"offset":87,"length":12}],"data":{}},{"key":"3v0uh","text":"Use q4md-forcefieldtools / PyRED server","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":4,"length":35}],"data":{}},{"key":"cbg7g","text":"Search in parameter databases like this one","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":30,"length":13}],"data":{}},{"key":"4vlne","text":"Search the AMBER mailing list to see if anyone else is willing to share their parameters: AMBER mailing list","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":90,"length":18}],"data":{}},{"key":"hbuc","text":"Adopt parameters from the literature","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h7dq","text":"...","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"er5lk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8o4qa","text":"You can use any of the above methods to generate AMBER-compatible parameters.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"gq22","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23g2h","text":"In this tutorial, we use AmberTools' antechamber to generate parameter files.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"D7B1D8802C0811EC941CFF2CCD971FF3","url":"http://ambermd.org/tutorials/basic/tutorial4b/"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"DFB982802C0811EC941CFF2CCD971FF3","url":"https://ambermd.org/tutorials/advanced/tutorial1/section1.htm"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"EA3D93A02C0711EC941CFF2CCD971FF3","url":"https://upjv.q4md-forcefieldtools.org/"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"152B4D902C0911EC941CFF2CCD971FF3","url":"http://amber.manchester.ac.uk/"}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"95C08C602C0711EC941CFF2CCD971FF3","url":"http://archive.ambermd.org/"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9gh83","text":"Export the Ligand as SDF File","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vm2m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"30hj4","text":"The 3p6h complex contains a ligand: Ibuprofen (IBP). This ligand is not part of the standard AMBER parameter set so you have to derive its parameters via antechamber (or from one of the above mentioned options).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":36,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9f6m8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fsqfb","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"crlnf","text":"We provide the ligand structure to antechamber as .sdf file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":50,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hn0v","text":"To prepare a .sdf file with the prepared ligand structure, follow these steps: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2eu4q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nrc3","text":"Select the ligand atoms in Maestro's Workspace, right-click the selected atoms and select Create New Entry by → Copying Selected Atoms. This creates a new entry in Maestro only containing the ligand atoms.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":90,"length":19},{"style":"bold","offset":112,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5g37o","text":"Select the ligand entry in the Entry List on the left side of Maestro, right-click and select Export  → Structures","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":31,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":94,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":104,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1oh06","text":"Enter ibp.sdf as file name.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"04454B60338111EBAA995B1596B3F3E0","height":197,"id":182141,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":23,"style":"italic"}],"key":"at86f","text":"A 2D representation of Ibuprofen","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","original_name":"image.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/76a50887d8f1c2e9301755428990ad81479ee21c25b43215cf524541e0503269/csf2jc.png","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ft57jc.jpg","type":1,"webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ft56jc.webp","width":329}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1b7p2","text":"Convert the AMBER Parameters to a Viparr Template","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":49}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98ahv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fepa9","text":"The parameters need to be converted into a format that you can use with Desmond, enter the following command to generate a viparr-formatted template: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rogg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"avf7e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ll6s","text":"After the program finishes, a new directory IBP is created, which contains the viparr-formatted AMBER template for Ibuprofen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":44,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"41p3o","text":"[AmberTools21] [schrodinger.ve] %\u003e viparr-convert-amber -m ligand -p IBP.frcmod -t IBP.prepi IBP/","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4kdcp","text":"Initialize a new Python virtual environment using the Schrödinger software:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"atpjk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c2qne","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3t8nl","text":"%\u003e $SCHRODINGER/run schrodinger_virtualenv.py schrodinger.ve","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7gd4b","text":"Activate the virtual environment:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5u51u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5soqv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dmbdr","text":"%\u003e source schrodinger.ve/bin/activate","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fv2ua","text":"Upgrade pip:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"iceo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"avcp3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"71abs","text":"[schrodinger.ve] %\u003e pip install --upgrade pip","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9pfr8","text":"Download these two Python packages from D.E. Shaw Research's GitHub repository:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41ql6","text":"Msys","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"a0kn3","text":"Viparr","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":6}],"data":{}},{"key":"4ujc0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epm89","text":"These packages are distributed in the Python 'wheel' format, compatible with 'manylinux2014' Linux distributions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"F4FCF431355611EBB3A90A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://github.com/DEShawResearch/msys/releases/download/1.7.318/msys-1.7.318-cp38-cp38-manylinux2014_x86_64.whl"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"F4FCF4A9355611EBB3A90A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://github.com/DEShawResearch/viparr/releases/download/4.7.35/viparr-4.7.35-cp38-cp38-manylinux2014_x86_64.whl"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4a2hm","text":"Install the packages into the virtual environment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtaav","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cnj53","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eni4g","text":"[schrodinger.ve] %\u003e pip install msys-1.7.318-cp38-cp38-manylinux2014_x86_64.whl","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"acdgm","text":"[schrodinger.ve] %\u003e pip install viparr-4.7.35-cp38-cp38-manylinux2014_x86_64.whl","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ehthj","text":"Clone the public Viparr parameters from D.E. Shaw Research's GitHub repository:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbrel","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"13dg","text":"Alternatively, you can download the repository as ZIP archive: viparr-ffpublic","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":63,"length":15}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a2qmq","text":"[schrodinger.ve] %\u003e git clone git://github.com/DEShawResearch/viparr-ffpublic.git","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"D880B12A355711EBB3A90A58A9FEAC2A","url":"https://github.com/DEShawResearch/viparr-ffpublic/archive/master.zip"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7bige","text":"Set the VIPARR_FFPATH environment variable","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87r6","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"41ud2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4vihf","text":"[schrodinger.ve] %\u003e export VIPARR_FFPATH=`pwd`/viparr-ffpublic/ff","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"67gp5","text":"Generate Custom AMBER Parameters with antechamber","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":49}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"396bg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1ar7","text":"We now derive partial charges for the IBP ligand by running:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2leb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4muql","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"12o5e","text":"with ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67dqo","text":"- the -fi flag we define the format of the input file (here: MDL SDF format).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69v4s","text":"- the -i flag we provide the name of the ligands .sdf file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6m990","text":"- the -fo flag we define the format of the output file (here: antechambers .prepi parameter format).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"527aj","text":"- the -c flag we define the parametrization method which is being used for deriving point charges (here: semi-empirical AM1-bcc).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"729sg","text":"- the -nc flag we define the total charge of the molecule.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aak67","text":"- the -rn flag we provide a residue name for our ligand.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2tv3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2shda","text":"Running the above command will roughly take one minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"256en","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9erlr","text":"After the job has completed successfully the parameter definition file IBP.prepi should have been created and the sqm.out output file should list at the end of the file:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":70,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":114,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"an49a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bh53","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e40mk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dfcr4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5ts3d","text":"[AmberTools21] [schrodinger.ve] %\u003e antechamber -fi mdl -i ibp.sdf -fo prepi -o IBP.prepi -c bcc -at amber -nc -1 -rn IBP","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4r2jo","text":"           --------- Calculation Completed ----------","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Assigning AMBER Force Fields to the Molecular System
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"305uu","text":"Run Viparr","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6nehq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"er2no","text":"To reassign the force field to AMBER, enter the following command:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6cp06","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"foei6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hqrn","text":"With","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0hpm","text":"-f aa.amber.ff19SB the AMBER ff19SB parameters are assigned to the protein part","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mv2u","text":"-f water.tip3p the TIP3P 3-site water model will be used as water model","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3jtma","text":"-f ions.amber1jc.tip3p Ambers monovalent ion parameters will be used","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"q9d0","text":"-d IBP we provide the viparr template for the IBP ligand","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5undp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"avhq4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7on3f","text":"After viparr finishes, a new file: amber-start.cms is created which contains the structure and AMBER force field information.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":35,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fdj1p","text":"[AmberTools21] [schrodinger.ve] %\u003e viparr desmond_setup_1-out.cms amber-start.cms -f aa.amber.ff19SB -f water.tip3p -f ions.amber1jc.tip3p -d IBP","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"249nn","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1vkme","text":"Importing forcefield from ../viparr-ffpublic/ff/aa.amber.ff19SB","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1gd2f","text":"Importing forcefield from ../viparr-ffpublic/ff/water.tip3p","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"84bli","text":"Importing forcefield from ../viparr-ffpublic/ff/ions.amber1jc.tip3p","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dqrhc","text":"Importing forcefield from IBP","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dg7f7","text":"Importing structure from desmond_setup_1-out.cms","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3d75s","text":"WARNING: will NOT fix prochiral atom names because rename_atoms or rename_residues was not enabled","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1vnqh","text":"Exporting parametrized system to amber-start.cms","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9pdcj","text":"VIPARR exited successfully","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"erich","text":"For a list of further available AMBER parameters in viparr, have a look at viparrs help text:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7jl2f","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":12,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"478oe","text":"%\u003e viparr -h","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Assigning AMBER Force Fields to the Molecular System
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"957g3","text":"Clean Properties and Prepare for MD","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aabu2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85sf5","text":"To prepare the converted system for MD simulations, certain properties need to be removed from the CMS file and the full-system structure needs to be prepared. Run the Python program:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":183,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"l298","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"egpri","text":"This script will overwrite the file amber-start.cms. The system is now ready for simulation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"file","mutability":"","data":{"forceSelection":true,"guid":"BBACB38B356311EBB3A90A58A9FEAC2A","id":82310,"nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"gen_fsys.py","placeholder":"","source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/public/76a50887d8f1c2e9301755428990ad81479ee21c25b43215cf524541e0503269/csngbhnbf.py"}},"1":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7vrcp","text":"%\u003e $SCHRODINGER/run gen_fsys.py amber-start.cms","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"39h8u","text":"Install AmberTools + conda","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ao50a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d8jot","text":"AmberTools is needed for deriving force field parameters for the ligand.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ummr","text":"For installation of AmberTools + conda please follow the instructions on https://ambermd.org/GetAmber.php#ambertools .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":73,"length":43}],"data":{}},{"key":"632oo","text":"This tutorial used the installation procedure via conda.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctr8n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"44E510EA2C0411ECBD820A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://ambermd.org/GetAmber.php#ambertools"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"gbfm","text":"Run antechambers parmchk2 program to check which parameters are still missing. The parmchk2 program tries to make educated guesses for them and writes the information to the .frcmod file:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"28hfd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10sh5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cl637","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"79tat","text":"[AmberTools21] [schrodinger.ve] %\u003e parmchk2 -i IBP.prepi -f prepi -o IBP.frcmod","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ek1lm","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7vca5","text":"(optional) If you have installed AmberTools via the conda option (see Step 1.) it is now the right time to activate the AmberTools conda environment via:w","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c39gn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"91qgh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ev28v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"code_insert","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4ou1v","text":"[schrodinger.ve] %\u003e conda activate AmberTools21","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
